[[Mwingi North Constituency|Mwingi North]] {{small|(1997–2013)}} |majority10 = |birthname =Kalonzo }} '''Stephen Kalonzo Musyoka''' (born 24 December 1953) is a [[Kenya]]n politician who was the tenth [[Vice-President of Kenya]] from 2008 to 2013. Musyoka served in the government under President [[Daniel arap Moi]] and was [[List of Foreign Ministers of Kenya|Minister for Foreign Affairs]] from 1993 until 1998; subsequently, under President [[Mwai Kibaki]], he was Minister of Foreign Affairs again from 2003 to 2004, then Minister of the Environment from 2004 to 2005.{{cite web |url=http://www.iss.co.za/af/regorg/unity_to_union/pdfs/igad/confdec03.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-01-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060923111941/http://www.iss.co.za/AF/RegOrg/unity_to_union/pdfs/igad/confdec03.pdf |archivedate=23 September 2006 |df=dmy-all }} He was an unsuccessful candidate in the [[Kenyan presidential election, 2007|2007 presidential election]], after which he was appointed as Vice-President by Kibaki in January 2008. Musyoka is the party leader of the Wiper Democratic Movement (formerly [[Orange Democratic Movement-Kenya]]). He also serves as Chief Commissioner for [[The Kenya Scouts Association]].{{cite web|last=Vice President Pres Service|title=Kalonzo hails scouts for supporting tourism|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/archives/InsidePage.php?id=2000015674&cid=159&|publisher=Standard Group Limited|accessdate=27 April 2012}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==Early life and education== He was born in Tseikuru, in a remote part of Mwingi District (then part of [[Kitui District]]) in Kenya's [[Eastern Province (Kenya)|Eastern Province]]. Between 1960 and 1967 he studied at Tseikuru Full Primary School to attain basic education. Then he went to Kitui High School in [[Kitui]] for the ordinary level and eventually to Meru School in [[Meru, Kenya|Meru]] from where he graduated in the advanced level in 1973. Kalonzo Musyoka graduated with a Bachelor of Law degree from the [[University of Nairobi]] in 1977. He continued further studies at the [[Kenya School of Law]] in 1978 where he was awarded a Post graduate diploma in Law. In 1979, he attended the Mediterranean Institute of Management in [[Cyprus]] where he earned a post graduate Diploma in Business.Daily Nation [http://politics.nationmedia.com/kalonzo.asp Profile of Kalonzo Musyoka] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071017041400/http://politics.nationmedia.com/kalonzo.asp |date=17 October 2007 }} In 2009, he was awarded an honorary doctorate in divinity among other 17 beneficiaries at the Charter hall in [[Nairobi]]. This was one the "honorary professorships and doctorate degrees" that were issued by Professor Clyde Rivers, the International Commissioner of the [[Latin University of Theology]], based in [[Inglewood, California]].{{cite web|last1=SAMUEL|first1=OTIENO|title=US varsity floods Kenya with PhDs|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/archives/print.php?id=2000013995&cid=4|accessdate=26 April 2012|author2=JIBRIL ADAN}}
On 19 December 2008, Kalonzo Musyoka was honoured with a Doctorate in Humane Letters ([[honoris causa]]) in recognition of his achievements in peace making, conflict resolution efforts, sustainable community development and humanistic ideals by [[Kenyatta University]] during its 25th graduation.{{cite web|title=KU Honours Eminent Persons|url=http://www.ku.ac.ke/images/stories/docs/newsletters/vol4_issue15.pdf|publisher=Office of the Vice-Chancellor, Kenyatta University|accessdate=26 April 2012}} Named African Dignitary Man of the year 2016{{Cite news|url=https://www.standardmedia.co.ke/article/2000212765/wiper-party-celebrates-kalonzo-musyoka-s-prize|title=Wiper party celebrates Kalonzo Musyoka’s prize|last=Kajilwa|first=Graham|work=The Standard|access-date=2018-11-19|language=en}} ==Politics== Musyoka vied for the Kitui North Constituency parliamentary seat in 1983, but was defeated. At the time, Kenya was one-party state and the only party fielding candidates was [[Kenya African National Union]] (KANU). However, only two years later, in 1985 the Kitui North seat was vacated and Musyoka won subsequent by-elections, thus becoming an MP at the age of 32. In 1986 he was appointed Assistant Minister for Works, Housing and Physical Planning, serving until 1988. He was re-elected at the 1988 parliamentary elections and served as Deputy Speaker of the National assembly from 1988{{cite web|title=Office of the Vice President|url=http://www.information.go.ke/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=396&Itemid=524|accessdate=19 April 2012}} to 1992. He was also KANU's National Organizing Secretary from 1988 to 2002. ===1992–1997 Kenyan Parliament=== Kenya's first multiparty elections were held in 1992. Musyoka stayed in KANU, renewed his parliamentary position and was appointed Minister for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation. He also held couple of other ministerial positions while part of the KANU government. In June 1993, he addressed the [[World Conference on Human Rights]] in Austria which was the first human rights conference held since the end of the [[Cold War]]. He termed the illicit mineral trade which fuels and finances what he called 'the cause of incessant conflicts, environmental degradation but ultimately and sadly too, poverty'.{{cite web|last=Deborah Eade and Morna Macleod|title=Women and armed conflict: from victims to activists|url=http://www.minorityrights.org/download.php?id=1017|publisher=State of the World's Minorities and Indigenous Peoples 2011|accessdate=26 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120110185813/http://www.minorityrights.org/download.php?id=1017|archivedate=10 January 2012|df=dmy-all}} The [[Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action]] was the major result from this meeting after the participants reached a consensus.{{cite book | last=Norchi | first=Charles | chapter=Human Rights: A Global Common Interest | editor=Krasno, Jean E. | title=The United Nations: Confronting the Challenges of a Global Society | publisher=[[Lynne Rienner Publishers]] | year=2004 | isbn=1588262804 | page=87}} ===1997–2002 Kenyan Parliament=== He was again elected to the parliament at the 1997 elections, but now from [[Mwingi North Constituency]], since his former constituency Kitui North was split into new constituencies.Center for Multiparty Democracy: [http://www.cmd.or.ke/images/Politics%20and%20Paliamenterians%20in%20Kenya.pdf Politics and Parliamentarians in Kenya 1944–2007] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081028212845/http://www.cmd.or.ke/images/Politics%20and%20Paliamenterians%20in%20Kenya.pdf |date=28 October 2008 }} ===2002–2007 Kenyan Parliament=== In the months leading up to the [[Kenyan general election, 2002|2002 general election]], under the leadership of then KANU secretary general, [[Raila Odinga]], he decamped from KANU to join the [[Liberal Democratic Party (Kenya)|Liberal Democratic Party]] (LDP) as a founding member under the banner of the [[National Rainbow Coalition]], which went on to win the general elections. On 1 December 2003, as the Minister for home affairs and international co-operation for [[Kenya]], he welcomed the people to this meeting, whose theme was Strengthening the role of IGAD in regional peace initiatives and post conflict reconstruction on behalf of the republic of Kenya and thanked the Danish government, [[Intergovernmental Authority on Development|IGAD]] Secretariat and the ISS on behalf of the{{cite web|title=STRENGTHENING THE ROLE OF IGAD IN REGIONAL PEACE INITIATIVES AND POST CONFLICT RECONSTRUCTION|url=http://www.iss.co.za/pubs/CReports/IGADDec03/IGAD.htm|work=Institute of Security Studies|accessdate=25 April 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061012063755/http://www.iss.co.za/pubs/CReports/IGADDec03/IGAD.htm|archivedate=12 October 2006|df=dmy-all}} [[Intergovernmental Authority on Development#Current member states|IGAD Member States]] for their preparations and funding of the meeting. Kalonzo Musyoka was involved in the Sudan peace process between 1993 and 1997 and he was part of the team that reconstituted the draft establishing IGAD in 1995. Musyoka became Minister for Foreign Affairs for a second time under President [[Mwai Kibaki]], but in a cabinet reshuffle on 30 June 2004 he was moved to the post of Minister for the Environment. In late August 2004, he was additionally removed from his position as chairman of the Sudanese and Somali peace talks and was replaced by [[John Koech]].[http://www.sudantribune.com/spip.php?article5027 "Kenyan Kalonzo removed from Somali and Soudanese peace talks role"], ''The Nation'' (sudantribune.com), 27 August 2004. Musyoka was reportedly unhappy with President Kibaki's refusal to honour a pre-election ''Memorandum of understanding'' (MOU) which they had signed with the president's party [[National Alliance Party of Kenya|NAK]]. He was one of the leaders of the successful "No"-campaign in the [[2005 Kenyan constitutional referendum|November 2005 referendum on the proposed new constitution]]. Following the referendum, he was dismissed from the Cabinet.Patrick Nzioka, [http://allafrica.com/stories/200801080938.html "Kenya: Kalonzo Miracle Taking Shape"], ''The Nation'' (allAfrica.com), 9 January 2008. Subsequently, Kalonzo Musyoka decamped [[Liberal Democratic Party (Kenya)|Liberal Democratic Party]] (LDP) into the little-known Labor Party of Kenya.{{cite web|last=AMADALA|first=BENSON|title=Kenya: Rivals Now Plan to Register New ODM|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/200708050015.html|publisher=All Africa News|accessdate=26 May 2014}} Kalonzo Musyoka was widely expected to vie for the presidency in the [[Kenyan presidential election, 2007|December 2007 election]]. Musyoka campaigned for the ODM-Kenya ticket, facing a number of other contenders. His rating for December 2007 election steadily dropped, and political analysts wondered whether he would make a significant impact. His relationship with fellow ODM-Kenya leader [[Raila Odinga]], who was also after the ODM-Kenya presidential ticket, was the subject of much speculation. Many observers questioned whether the presidential hopefuls of ODM-Kenya, particularly Raila and Musyoka, could unite to support one common candidate for the general election. The ODM-Kenya split into two factions, one gathered around Musyoka and the other around Odinga, in August 2007. Musyoka was elected by his faction as its presidential candidate on 31 August 2007,Malcolm Webb, [http://www.voanews.com/english/2007-08-31-voa34.cfm "Kenya's Opposition Chooses Presidential Candidate"], VOA News, 31 August 2007.Eric Shimoli and Dave Opiyo, [http://allafrica.com/stories/200708311137.html "Kenya: Kalonzo Picked to Hoist ODM-K Flag"], ''The Nation'' (allAfrica.com), 1 September 2007. receiving 2,835 votes in a secret ballot against Julia Ojiambo, who received 791 votes. Musyoka has been quoted as saying "... the war against poverty could not be won unless environmental issues were addressed."{{Citation needed|date=January 2008}} Musyoka launched his [[Kenyan presidential election, 2007|presidential campaign]] at [[Uhuru Park]] in Nairobi on 14 October 2007. This move was criticised by those who saw him as a traitor to the ODM party of Raila Odinga. Kalonzo however said that "atapitia katikati" (passing between two people). ===After 2007=== [[File:Kalonzo Musyoka Greeting People in Mombasa.JPG|thumb|Musyoka greeting people in Mombasa]] According to official results, Musyoka placed a distant third behind Kibaki and Odinga with 9% of the vote.[http://www.communication.go.ke/elections/default.asp Page on 2007 results] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080405202149/http://www.communication.go.ke/elections/default.asp |date=5 April 2008 }} at Office of the Government Spokesman. Amid a [[Kenyan crisis, 2007-2008|violent crisis]] over the results, with supporters of Kibaki and Odinga disputing the outcome, Kibaki appointed Musyoka as Vice-President and Minister of Home Affairs on 8 January 2008.[http://allafrica.com/stories/200801080673.html "Kenya: Kibaki Names Cabinet"], ''The East African Standard'' (allAfrica.com), 8 January 2008. Musyoka expressed gratitude to Kibaki and, referring to the ongoing dispute and violence, said that he was "intensely aware that the appointment has come at a difficult time when our nation is going through a painful moment". He took office as Vice-President on 9 January.Mutinda Mwanzia, [http://allafrica.com/stories/200801100789.html "Kenya: Awori Hands Over to Kalonzo"], ''The East African Standard'' (allAfrica.com), 10 January 2008. [[File:Vice President of Kenya (7886399918).jpg|thumb|Vice President Kalonzo Musyoka meeting the British Foreign Secretary William Hague in London, 29 August 2012]] The political crisis eventually led to the signing of a power-sharing agreement between Kibaki and Odinga. In the Grand Coalition Cabinet that was announced on 13 April 2008, Musyoka remained Vice-President and Minister of Home Affairs.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7345318.stm "Kenya unveils coalition cabinet"], BBC News, 13 April 2008.Anthony Kariuki, [http://politics.nationmedia.com/inner.asp?pcat=NEWS&cat=TOP&sid=1787 "Kibaki names Raila PM in new Cabinet"]{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, nationmedia.com, 13 April 2008. In 2010 Musyoka supported the draft constitution in the campaign for [[Kenyan constitutional referendum, 2010|4 August referendum]] but Members of the campaign team opposing the draft constitution claimed that he was secretly opposing the draft leading to a satirical comparison of Musyoka to a watermelon which is naturally green outside and red inside, the team supporting the draft constitution was represented by color green while the team opposing the draft constitution was represented by the color red hence the "green team" and the "red team", Musyoka's nickname watermelon was because of his alleged open support for the green team and secret support for the red team.{{cite web|last=Kikechi|first=Biketi|title='No' strategy rattles 'Yes'|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/business/article/2000013085/no-strategy-rattles-yes|accessdate=26 May 2014}} Most of the opposition of the draft constitution were the clergy. ===2013 Elections=== In the race for the 4th president of Kenya, Kalonzo Musyoka joined his longtime political opponent [[Raila Odinga]] to form the [[Coalition for Reforms and Democracy]] (CORD) with Musyoka shelving his presidential ambition to run as Odinga's [[running mate]].{{cite web|last=Mosoku|first=Geoffrey|title=Raila, Kalonzo seal deal as Mudavadi joins Uhuru, Ruto|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/?articleID=2000072150|publisher=Standard Media Group|accessdate=26 May 2014}}{{cite web|last=NAMUNANE|first=BERNARD|title=Raila and Kalonzo finally sign deal|url=http://www.nation.co.ke/News/politics/Raila-and-Kalonzo-finally-sign-deal/-/1064/1635856/-/a3xmex/-/index.html|work=Daily Nation|accessdate=26 May 2014}} When the first round of the presidential election took place on 4 March 2013, [[Uhuru Kenyatta]] was declared the [[president-elect]] of [[Kenya]] by the [[Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission]]. [[Raila Odinga]] challenged this in the [[Supreme Court of Kenya]]. Questions were raised why Musyoka was not a petitioner in the case. After the Supreme Court dismissed the [[The Kenya Presidential Election Petition 2013|CORD Petition]], he left office when the President-elect, Uhuru Kenyatta, was sworn in. ===2017 Elections=== ==Other responsibilities== Dr Kalonzo Musyoka has, since 10 June 2013, served as the [[Chancellor|University Chancellor]] of the [[Uganda Technology and Management University]] (UTAMU), a privately owned university in [[Uganda]], based in [[Kampala]], that country's [[capital city|capital]] and largest city.{{cite web| url=https://www.newvision.co.ug/new_vision/news/1458567/kalonzo-tenure-utamu-chancellor-extended |title=Kalonzo Musyoka's tenure as UTAMU chancellor extended |access-date=24 February 2018 | date=26 July 2017 |newspaper=[[New Vision]] |location=Kampala | first=Sauda |last=Nabatanzi}} ==Personal life== Kalonzo Musyoka is married to Pauline. They have four children. He was baptised by Pastor Masila Munyoki. He is the patron of the Kalonzo Musyoka Foundation and he has served since 2006.{{cite web |url=http://www.kalonzomusyokafoundation.org/aboutus/aboutus_page.aspx?page=Patronforeword |title=About us – Kalonzo Musyoka Foundation |publisher=kalonzomusyokafoundation.org |year=2012 |accessdate=3 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111118042615/http://www.kalonzomusyokafoundation.org/aboutus/aboutus_page.aspx?page=Patronforeword |archivedate=18 November 2011 |df=dmy-all }} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} * {{Official website}} * [http://www.information.go.ke/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=396&Itemid=524 Vice President's Profile] * [http://softkenya.com/kenyans/stephen-kalonzo-musyoka Kalonzo Musyoka]- Profile, Biography & Timeline {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box|title=[[Vice-President of Kenya]]|before=[[Moody Awori]]|after=[[William Ruto]]|years=2008–2013}} {{s-end}} {{Kenya-Ministers of Foreign Affairs}} {{KenyaVPs}} {{Current Kenyan MPs}} {{2007 presidential candidates, Kenya}} {{2013 presidential running mates, Kenya}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Musyoka, Kalonzo}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice-Presidents of Kenya]] [[Category:Government ministers of Kenya]] [[Category:People from Kitui County]] [[Category:Wiper Democratic Movement – Kenya politicians]] [[Category:Kamba people]] [[Category:National Rainbow Coalition politicians]] [[Category:Kenya School of Law alumni]] [[Category:Candidates for President of Kenya]] [[Category:Kenya African National Union politicians]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2014}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Big Brother 11'' housemates (UK)}} {{BLP sources|date=August 2010}} The following is a list of housemates in the [[Big Brother 11 (UK)|eleventh series of ''Big Brother'']], broadcast on [[Channel 4]] between June and August 2010.
==Andrew== Andrew Martin Edmonds (born 1990) was age 20<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> from [[Wimborne Minster]], [[Dorset]], a mathematics student at [[St Anne's College, Oxford|St. Anne's College]], [[University of Oxford]]. He passed [[GCE Advanced Level|A-level]] [[mathematics|maths]] when he was 13. He entered the house along with Keeley and Rachel in a spaceship on Day 31. He was also the victim of two secret tasks set by the Tree of Temptation, one where he was to act like [[Jack Bauer]] from ''[[24 (TV series)|24]]'' for 24 minutes, and another where he was forced to answer affirmatively to any question a housemate asked him. On Day 53 Andrew made history by becoming the first housemate to solve a Millennium Problem while in the house. Andrew left the house on Day 77 in 5th place, with 3.9% of the five-way vote to win.<ref>{{cite web|title= Andrew Finishes Fifth|publisher= Channel 4|date= 24 August 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/article/news/2010/Aug/24/andrew-finishes-fifth/view.c4|accessdate= 26 April 2011}}</ref> He is currently working on his second album, an autobiographical work entitled ''The Genius of Self'' expected to be released in the first half of 2021.
==Ben== Benjamin Duncan was a 30-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> writer and broadcaster from [[London]] and attended the [[University of Kent]] and the [[University of St Andrews]]. He supports the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]]. He previously appeared in TV reality shows such as ''[[Ladette to Lady]]'' and similar American shows ''[[The Girls of Hedsor Hall]]'' and ''American Princess'',<ref>{{IMDb name|3024562|Ben Duncan}}</ref> usually as an [[eligible bachelor]] for the female contestants.<ref>{{cite web|title= Ben - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/ben/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> Other TV appearances include being a juror in ''[[Sex In Court]]'' and assisting friend [[Raef Bjayou]] in ''[[Come Dine With Me|Celebrity Come Dine With Me]]''.<ref>{{cite web|author=8 July 2010 by Frankie Genchi |url=http://www.fleckingrecords.co.uk/2010/07/check-out-big-brother-11s-ben-duncan-on-come-dine-with-me.html |title=Check out Big Brother 11's Ben Duncan on Come Dine With Me |publisher=Fleckingrecords.co.uk |date=8 July 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref> He has a non-speaking part as a background artist in the 2006 film, "The Queen". He was evicted on Day 52, with 52% of the vote. He re-entered the house on week 10 as part of Bob Righter's prediction task for one hour. Following the show, Ben took part in filming for TV series ''[[Coach Trip#Celebrity Coach Trip|Celebrity Coach Trip]]'', again with Bjayou.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s136/coach-trip/news/a277261/celebrity-coach-trip-lineup-revealed.html |title=Celebrity 'Coach Trip' lineup revealed |author=Alex Fletcher |date=16 September 2010 |work=[[Digital Spy]]}}</ref> He was also interviewed during the broadcast of The Royal Wedding of 2011, giving his opinions on the event.
==Caoimhe== Caoimhe Guilfoyle ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|iː|v|ə}} {{respell|KEE|və}}) was a 23-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> mature student from Dublin who worked part-time as a [[DJ]] and lived with her parents.<ref>{{cite web|title= Caoimhe - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/caoimhe/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> During her time in the Big Brother house, she spent most of her time with housemate Shabby. Shabby told Caoimhe that she fancied her; Caoimhe revealed in the Diary Room that she does not fancy Shabby and is in love with her boyfriend. Towards the time of Shabby's exit, Caoimhe told fellow housemates that she felt she had been a "lesbian sidekick" most of her time. Caoimhe walked out of the House on Day 42.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1296225/Big-Brother-2010-Caoimhe-dramatically-quits-Big-Brother-walks-just-days-eviction.html|title=Big Brother 2010: Caoimhe dramatically quits Big Brother as she walks out just days before eviction|date=20 July 2010|work=Mail Online}}</ref>
==Corin== Corin Edith Forshaw was a 29-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> shop worker from [[Stockport]] who claimed to be often mistaken for glamour model [[Katie Price (Jordan)|Jordan]] due to her 30G bust.<ref name="Corin">{{cite web|title= Corin - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/corin/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> She was widowed when her husband of four months, Alex Hayden, was killed in a building site vehicle accident in September 2005.<ref>{{cite news|title= Tributes paid to gravel crush dad|work=[[Tameside Advertiser]]|date= 9 June 2010|url=http://menmedia.co.uk/tamesideadvertiser/news/s/504240_tributes_paid_to_gravel_crush_dad|last=White|first=Emilene|location=Manchester|accessdate= 10 June 2010}}</ref> She is [[bisexual]], and has been with her girlfriend for more than two years.<ref name="Corin"/> She was evicted on Day 73 with 20.6% of the public vote.
==Dave== Dave Vaughan was a 39-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> Christian minister from [[Pontypool]] who had been married for eighteen years and had four children: Natasha, Joshua, Jesse and Isaac.<ref>{{cite web|title= Dave - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/dave/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> He is an avid [[Cardiff City FC]] supporter and is an ambassador for the club. Whilst in the house he was seen ending tasks with the famous [[The Ayatollah (football celebration)|Ayatollah]] celebration dance that is normally performed by the City football fans. He entered the house on Day 1, and finished as runner up to the title.
==Govan== Govan Artis Zachary Hinds ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|dʒ|oʊ|v|æ|n}}; born 1989) was 21 years old, [[unemployed]] and [[single person|single]], from [[Leicester]].<ref>{{cite web|title= Govan - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/govan/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> Prior to entering the house, Govan told the ''Big Brother'' producers that he is bisexual, however he later revealed this to be a lie to get on the show.<ref>{{cite web|last=Llewellyn |first=Angharad |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/big_brother/3015208/Housemate-Govan-lied-about-sexuality.html |title=Housemate Govan lied about sexuality |Showbiz|Big Brother |work=The Sun |date=15 June 2010 |accessdate=12 July 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/news/a227335/govan-admits-he-is-not-bisexual.html |title=Big Brother 11 |work=Digital Spy |date=15 June 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref> On Day 17, he became the second housemate to be evicted from the house with 72% of the public vote.
==Ife== Ifeoluwa "Ife" Kukon ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|iː|f|eɪ}}; born 17 September 1984 in [[London Borough of Lambeth|Lambeth]], London) was a 25-year-old professional dancer from [[Milton Keynes]] who once worked as a back-up dancer for [[Cheryl Cole]] and also as a backing vocalist on singing contest ''[[The X Factor (UK)|The X Factor]]''. She is engaged to her boyfriend of six years and lives with both him and her adoptive parents. Ife is expecting her first child!.<ref>{{cite web|title= Ife - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/ife/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> Ife was evicted on Day 38 with 56.5% of the public vote.
==JJ== [[JJ Bird|Joe-John Daniel "JJ" Bird]] (born 9 September 1986)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.britishboxing.net/boxers_78031-JJ-Bird.html|title=JJ BIrd|publisher=BritishBoxing.net|accessdate=24 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301004234/http://www.britishboxing.net/boxers_78031-JJ-Bird.html|archivedate=1 March 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref> was aged 23, a professional boxer and barman originally from [[Peterborough]], living in [[London]]. His parents are publicans and he is best friends with [[Aston Merrygold]] from [[JLS]].<ref>{{cite news|title=CRIME: Thief's KO blow for boxer Joe|work=[[Peterborough Evening Telegraph]]|publisher=[[Johnston Press]]|date= 2 October 2003|accessdate= 24 July 2010|url=http://www.peterboroughtoday.co.uk/news/environment/crime_thief_s_ko_blow_for_boxer_joe_1_144344|location=Peterborough}}</ref> He entered the House on Day 45.<ref>{{cite web|title= JJ - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 23 July 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/jj/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 23 July 2010}}</ref> and was evicted on Day 77, finishing in 4th place.
==Jo== Jo Butler (born 1969) was age 41<!-- at time of entry, do not change-->, a make-up artist from [[Luton]]. She was training to be a club [[DJ]] using the [[moniker]] "DJ Naked" and referred to herself as a would-be "[[Cougar (slang)|cougar]]". She entered the House on Day 45.<ref>{{cite web|title= Jo - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 23 July 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/jo/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 23 July 2010}}</ref> She was evicted on Day 66 with 39.4% of the public vote.
==John James== John James Parton (born 28 August 1985){{Citation needed|date=August 2010}} was age 25<!-- at time of entry, do not change-->, an ex-vehicle body builder from [[Melbourne]], Australia. He was born to parents from the United Kingdom. Parton was single on entering the house and lives with his mother. He once had his name changed to Achilles, but later had it changed back.<ref>{{cite web|title= John - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/john/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> His father, also called John, died in a work accident when a steel frame in the factory he was working on collapsed in high winds in April 2008.<ref>{{cite news|title=Two killed in 130km/h wild winds |work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]|date= 3 April 2008|url= http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/national/galeforce-winds-wreak-havoc/story-e6freuzr-1111115957273|location=Surry Hills, New South Wales|author1=Wotherspoon, Sarah |author2=Hastie, David |author3=Anderson, Paul |author4=Dunn, Mark |accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> John James became close to fellow housemate Josie Gibson and since leaving the house they confirmed their boyfriend/girlfriend status and lived together in London. He was evicted on Day 73 with 34.2% of the public vote.<ref>John James Parton goes home to Australia, Australian Times. http://australiantimes.co.uk/entertainment/John-James-Parton-goes-home-to-Australia</ref> On 28 March 2011 it was announced in ''OK!'' that John James and Josie's relationship wasn't working and the pair were taking a break. John James had already returned home to his native Australia when the article was published. On 4 April 2011 Josie confirmed on Twitter that "JJJ" (as the pair were branded by fans) were "no more". She stated: "Its done guys. No more jjj. Sorry. Looks like OK were right. X"
In 2018, he appeared as a contestant on [[Love Island Australia]].
==Josie== {{main|Josie Gibson}} Josie Diane Shirley Gibson<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bb-cache.channel4.com/bigbrother/article/news/2010/Sep/3/john-james-and-josie-to-chat-live/view.c4 |title=Big Brother - Channel 4 |publisher=Bb-cache.channel4.com |date=10 September 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref> was a 26-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> financial sales rep from [[Bristol]]. At the age of 14 she left home to live on her Aunt Kay's farm. She was the first contestant to be selected by Big Brother to be a housemate on day 1. Throughout her stay she received only five nominations for eviction and never once faced the public vote. She entered into a relationship with fellow housemate John James Parton and upon leaving Big Brother the pair confirmed their boyfriend/girlfriend status. On Day 66, she was voted by her fellow housemates to win a ticket to the final of BB 2010. On Day 77, she won Big Brother 2010 and the [[pound sterling|£]]100,000 prize, with 77.5% of the five-way vote. She then re-entered the Big Brother house to compete in [[Ultimate Big Brother]]. On day 3 of that series she walked out.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-11101651 |title=Josie walks out of Ultimate Big Brother after two days |publisher=BBC |date=26 August 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref> Since leaving ''Big Brother'' she has appeared on ''[[Big Brother's Little Brother]]'' and ''[[Big Brother's Big Mouth]]''. She featured in a one-off reality TV programme which was broadcast on 11 October 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/view/157611/Big-Brother-lovers-Josie-and-John-James-on-wed-alert/ |title=BIG BROTHER LOVERS JOSIE AND JOHN JAMES ON WED ALERT |date=10 October 2010 |author=John Ward |newspaper=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]}}</ref> A further three-part series was broadcast in May 2011. Josie has raised funds to support children's cancer charity [[CLIC Sargent]]. She donated [[pound sterling|£]]20,000 of her winnings to the charity when she left Big Brother.<ref>{{cite web|last=Monster |first=Space |url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/news/Undefined-Headline/article-2572589-detail/article.html |title=Bristol charity CLIC Sargent 'thrilled' by Big Brother winner Josie's pledge |publisher=Thisisbristol.co.uk |date=26 August 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref> On 28 March 2011 it was announced in ''OK!'' that Josie and John James's relationship wasn't working and the pair were taking a break. John James had already returned home to his native Australia when the article was published. On 4 April 2011 Josie confirmed on Twitter that "JJJ" (as the pair were branded by fans) were "no more".
==Keeley== Keeley Joyce Johnson (born 1979) was from [[Manchester]]. Before entering the house, she was the manager of a travel agency in [[Oldham]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Our experts|url=http://www.co-operativetravel.co.uk/exclusives/experts/|accessdate= 11 July 2010}}</ref> having worked in the industry since joining a Youth Training Scheme in 1995.<ref>{{cite web|title=Running a travel agency: tips from an award-winning manager|year= 2008|url=http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/Articles/2008/08/21/28542/running-a-travel-agency-tips-from-an-award-winning.html|accessdate= 11 July 2010}}</ref> On Day 42 Keeley left the House to receive treatment in hospital for her injured ankle, an injury which she sustained during Week Six's 'Save and Replace' task.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keeley leaves house for treatment |url=http://www.bbspy.co.uk/0720/news/keeley-leaves-house-for-treatment|accessdate= 20 July 2010}}</ref> On Day 45, Big Brother announced to the House that because she wished to recuperate at home following her injury, Keeley did not return to the Big Brother House.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/article/news/2010/Jul/23/breaking-news-about-keeley/view.c4 |title=Breaking news about Keeley |publisher=Channel 4 |date=10 September 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2012}}</ref>
==Laura== Laura McAdam (born 1989) was age 20<!-- at time of entry, do not change-->, a cashier from [[Stratford-upon-Avon]]. She entered the House on Day 45 and voluntarily left the house on Day 50. Her time in the Big Brother house was one of the shortest ever at just under 105 hours, second only to Isaac Stout of Big Brother 2009. She left the house through the fire exit.
==Mario== Mario Mugan was a 30-year-old<!-- at time of entry, do not change-->, single and unemployed, openly [[gay]] man. He was born near [[Venice]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bigbrother/news/a225354/mario-wants-another-gay-housemate.html|title=Mario wants another gay housemate|work=Digital Spy}}</ref> brought up in the United States by his mother, but now lives in [[Essex]].<ref name="Mario - Profile">{{cite web|title= Mario - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/mario/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> He has never met his father. Mario is half-[[Italian people|Italian]]/half-[[Welsh people|Welsh]] and believes in the paranormal. Mario is a massive Big Brother fan and owns the Diary Room chair from [[Big Brother 2006 (UK)|Big Brother 2006]].<ref name="Mario - Profile"/> Unlike the other contestants, Mario was chosen to be a housemate by a random draw rather than by being hand picked by the Big Brother producers. Because he was chosen randomly, Big Brother made Mario the house "''mole''" in what the show described as an "''impossible''" task to avoid eviction. Mario was provided with a mole costume and sign to wear around his neck stating that he is a mole which he was instructed to wear twenty-four hours a day. As part of his task Mario was required to undertake several tasks, including ruining his housemates' food and cigarettes.<ref>{{cite web|title= Mario The Mole is Fourteenth Housemate|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/article/news/2010/Jun/9/mario-the-mole-is-fourteenth-housemate/view.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> In a vote, set up by Big Brother, the majority of the housemates incorrectly guessed that Sunshine was the house mole and as a result Mario was permitted to remain in the house. He was evicted on Day 77, finishing in third place.
==Nathan== Nathan Dunn was 25<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> years old, comes from [[Bingley]], [[West Yorkshire]]. He was learning to become a [[joiner]] and was living with his grandparents. He once attended a private school until the age of eleven when he decided to fail his exams so he could join a friend at a local comprehensive school.<ref>{{cite web|title= Nathan - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/nathan/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> On Day 31, Nathan was evicted with 89% of the vote. Nathan is now engaged to Rachael White from the same series.
==Rachael== Rachael White was 23 years old<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> and comes from [[Derby]]. She works as a model,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.modelmayhem.com/1953374|title=ModelMayhem.com - Rachael White - Model - London, England, United Kingdom}}</ref> hair stylist and as a [[Beyoncé Knowles]] lookalike.<ref>{{cite web|title= Rachael - Profile|publisher= Channel 4|date= 9 June 2010|url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/rachael/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> On Day 10, she became the first housemate to be evicted from the house with 37.5% of the public vote. Rachael is now engaged to Nathan Dunn from the same series.<ref>{{cite web|title= Nathan: Rachael is my girlfriend|work= The Sun|date= 19 August 2010|url= http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/big_brother/3102857/Nathan-Rachael-is-my-girlfriend.html|accessdate= 15 April 2011}}</ref>
==Rachel== Rachel Louise Ifon (born 1981) was 29<!-- at time of entry, do not change-->. She was originally from [[Liverpool]], spent a brief period in [[Tel Aviv]], [[Israel]] working as a [[flight attendant]] for [[El Al]] and was working for [[RyanAir]] at [[Liverpool John Lennon Airport]], where she lived. Previously she was a [[Bingo (non-US)|bingo caller]] and became a contestant in [[Pop Idol]] [[Pop Idol (series 2)|in 2003]], reaching the top 50 but failing to win a place in the final.<ref>{{cite web|title= Rachel's night to shout about| publisher= Channel 4|date= 29 September 2003<!-- 2003-->|url=http://icliverpool.icnetwork.co.uk/0100news/0100regionalnews/content_objectid=13461227_method=full_siteid=50061_headline=-Rachel-s-night-to-shout-about-name_page.html|accessdate= 11 July 2010}}</ref> She claims to have been written about in the autobiography of [[Simon Cowell]].<ref>{{cite web|title= RACHEL| publisher= Channel 4|url=http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/rachel/profile/display.c4|accessdate= 11 July 2010}}</ref> She was evicted on Day 59 with 58.5% of the public vote.
==Sam== {{main|Sam Pepper}} Samuel "Sam" Pepper (26 March 1989) was born in [[Ashford, Kent]] to [[Greek people|Greek]] parents.<ref>{{cite web|title=NEW HOUSEMATE REVEALED: It's Sam!|publisher= Channel 4|date= 30 July 2010|url=http://bb-cache.channel4.com/bigbrother/article/news/2010/Jul/30/new-housemate-revealed-it-s-sam/view.c4|accessdate= 30 July 2010}}</ref> He was educated at [[Pent Valley Technology College]]. He entered the house on Day 52 as Laura's replacement as part of the "ignore the obvious" task. He had applied for the previous years and had entered the test house.<ref name="DS Sam">[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s149/big-brother/interviews/a265303/samuel-pepper-john-james-parton-big-brother-11.html Samuel Pepper, John James Parton ('Big Brother 11')], Digital Spy, 21 August 2010. Retrieved 11 August 2013.</ref> He was evicted on Day 73 with 14.6% of the public vote.
==Shabby== Shabby Eliot-Katchadourian (30 April 1986),<ref name="Sun">{{cite news |title=Upper crusty |work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]] |date= 14 June 2010 |url= http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/big_brother/3012426/Big-Brother-squatter-Shabby-is-a-posh-girl.html |author=Sam-Daliri, Nadia |accessdate= 15 June 2010}}</ref> is an<!-- at time of entry, do not change--> actress, singer and filmmaker who appeared in ''[[Black Beauty (1994 film)|Black Beauty]]'' as a child (credited as "Keeley Flanders")<ref>{{IMDb name|0281136|Keylee Jade Flanders}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://actors.mandy.com/uk/view.php?uid=231439 |title=Mandy Actors |publisher=mandy.com |accessdate=12 July 2010}}</ref> and was on a shortlist for the lead role in ''[[The Parent Trap (1998 film)|The Parent Trap]]''. She has also appeared in 1998 film ''[[Hilary and Jackie]]'', portraying the character of "Young Hilary". In 1998 she also appeared in an episode of the medical documentary series ''Body Story'' playing a girl named Lisa Mason. The episode showed what happened to her body in response to a broken arm bone. She also appeared as "Fanny" in the 1999 miniseries ''[[Wives and Daughters (1999 miniseries)|Wives and Daughters]]'' as well as featuring in emergency medical drama television series ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'', as the character of "Kitty", in 2009. After ''Big Brother'', Shabby appeared as one of the leads in the Channel Five series ''Candy Bar Girls'' which launched in July 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/news/a303041/channel-5-reveals-candy-bar-series.html |title=The Candy Bar Girls |accessdate=12 February 2011}}</ref> She is a [[lesbian]] and used to squat in a Victorian house in south London. Shabby voluntarily left the house on Day 27 following an argument with fellow housemate, Nathan.
==Steve== Steven Gill (born 1969){{citation needed|date=July 2010}} was a father of eight children. He was living in [[Leicester]] and had been married to his second wife for 14 years. He is a former soldier who lost both legs, both lungs and an eye in a bomb blast in [[Belfast]] whilst serving in Northern Ireland. Despite his disabilities, he competed in the [[Royal Ocean Racing Club|Royal Ocean Yacht Race]], and is a transatlantic yacht racer.<ref>{{cite web |title= Steve - Profile |publisher= Channel 4 |date= 9 June 2010 |url= http://www.channel4.com/bigbrother/housemate/steve/profile/display.c4 |accessdate= 9 June 2010}}</ref> He was evicted on Day 73 with 9.8% of the public vote.
==Sunshine== Yvette Sarah "Sunshine" Martyn (born 1985) was a 24-year-old medical student originally from [[Peterborough]]. Known as Dr Sparkle in the hospital, she had gained the nickname Sunshine due to her positive attitude and happy nature. It was revealed on the show that she had experienced three near-death experiences on her travels around the world: being mugged at knifepoint in [[Turkey]], accidentally overdosing in India on [[antimalarial drug|anti-malarial medication]] and being [[spider bite|bitten by a poisonous spider]] in Australia. She is the first-ever vegan Big Brother housemate. Interested in diet and lifestyle medicine, she promotes a plant based diet. Sunshine holds the record for receiving the most nominations in one week in the history of Big Brother UK, after she received ten nominations in week 1, despite this she survived the public vote. On Big Brother’s Little Brother she announced that she had gained a First Class honors degree in Medical Journalism. At the Big Brother final Sunshine revealed that she had returned to her medical degree. Since the show, she has qualified as a doctor and gained membership to the Royal College of Physicians. She currently specializes in Occupational Medicine. She has continued to work in the media. She has written for numerous medical and mainstream publications and has appeared as a medical expert commenting on health matters on television news platforms.<ref>{{cite web|title= Personal Website|publisher= Sunshine Martyn|date= 1 July 2018|url= http://www.itssunshine.com|accessdate= 1 July 2018}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''The Apprentice'' candidates (UK series 7)}} {{The Apprentice UK candidate list}} {{Main|The Apprentice (UK series seven)}} {{Refimprove|date=June 2011}} Nominated for RFD: see [[Wikipedia:Redirects for discussion]]
== Edna Agbarha == Edna Agbarha, 36, was a London-based business psychologist prior to filming. She has a bachelor's degree in psychology from the [[University of East London]], a master's degree in occupational psychology from [[Goldsmiths, University of London]], and an [[MBA]] qualification from [[Imperial College Business School]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www3.imperial.ac.uk/newsandeventspggrp/imperialcollege/businessschool/events_summary/event_21-3-2011-14-45-34 |title=Ten ways to make or break a financial trading career |publisher=[[Imperial College Business School]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linkedin.com/pub/edna-agbarha/2/494/50b |title=Edna do Rosário Martins - United Kingdom |publisher=LinkedIn |date= |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> During the process, Edna lead her team to a win in Week 2, despite making the questionable decision to pitch at a games fair herself, when there were a number other candidates who would arguably have been more suitable; many of the team thought the pitch had cost them victory, and were surprised to learn they had won by a large margin. After 5 successive task wins, Edna was brought into the boardroom in Week 6 by Zoe Beresford, where she was accused of claiming credit for the successful ideas of others. When Lord Sugar asked why he should let Edna continue, she highlighted her academic qualifications, but this only resulted in her digging an even bigger hole for herself, and Lord Sugar fired her. She later that she should have brought up her professional experience. She was the only candidate that eventual winner Tom Pellereau didn't work with during the series.
== Zoe Beresford == Zoe Beresford, 26, was a pupil of [[Abbots Bromley School]], an [[independent school]] in the village of [[Abbots Bromley]] in [[Staffordshire]], and holds a master's degree in manufacturing, engineering and management from the [[University of Nottingham]],<ref name="SGB">{{cite web |url=http://www.sgboutdoor.co.uk/news/fullstory.php/aid/3878/AMG_appoints_Midlands_North_territory_manager.html |title=AMG appoints Midlands/North territory manager |work=SGB Outdoor |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130505053206/http://www.sgboutdoor.co.uk/news/fullstory.php/aid/3878/AMG_appoints_Midlands_North_territory_manager.html |archivedate=5 May 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> where she was awarded a [[Rolls-Royce plc|Rolls-Royce]] Manufacturing Technology Prize for the School of Engineering's highest dissertation mark. She lives in [[Arclid]], Cheshire and worked as a Project Manager for a drinks manufacturer until January 2011, when she was appointed territory manager for an outdoor/snow footwear retail company.<ref name="SGB" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.creweguardian.co.uk/news/9106536.Apprentice_Hopeful_Zoe_s_Win_In_Paris/ |title=Apprentice Hopeful Zoe's Win In Paris (From Crewe Guardian) |newspaper=Crewe Guardian |date=25 June 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> She suffered two bouts of cancer, aged 15 and 18.<ref>{{cite web|last=Harmsworth |first=Andrei |url=http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/867877-the-apprentice-loser-zoe-beresford-still-a-winner-after-beating-cancer |title=The Apprentice loser Zoe Beresford still a winner after beating cancer | Metro News |publisher=Metro.co.uk |date=29 June 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> On The Apprentice, Zoe came to the fore in week 3 when she was brought into the boardroom by Gavin Winstanley for disruptive behaviour, although she got off lightly since Lord Sugar did not hold directly responsible for the loss. In week 4 she was placed in the role of Project manager for Venture in the beauty treatments task. She relied on industry expert Susan Ma's advice when choosing product quantities, but halved the size of the order after consideration; even the new quantity proved far too much, as Venture only made a little over £200, a poor figure for such a market. Zoe blamed this on Susan on the task, and on the ''You're Fired'' programme that followed, Felicity Jackson took the view Zoe had been setting Susan up as a potential scapegoat.
In week 6 Zoe took on the role of Project manager again, but on this occasion she lost the task after failing to secure both of the deals arranged by Lord Sugar for waste disposal. Although Zoe was tearful at the end of the first day over the failure, she rallied on the second and Venture made separate deals of their own, so the end result was a difference of only £6. Zoe brought Susan and Edna into the boardroom, and once again came into conflict with Susan, who perceived Zoe as unnecessarily negative and unpleasant, while Zoe considered Susan to be naive and immature. Zoe's survival was mostly a result of her admitting fault at the first opportunity. In week 9, Zoe became project manager for the biscuit-making task, something similar to her day job before the series. However, her decision to manage marketing rather than the factory led to a snap and share biscuit design that was deemed to be too poor a quality to warrant the price. This led to team Logic securing no orders and suffering the worst defeat in the show's history. Lord Sugar decided to fire Zoe for not showcasing her strengths.
== Alex Britez Cabral == Twenty-eight-year-old Alex is a manager of an estate agency. Alex was criticised in week 1 for selling only £8 worth on the task, spending most of the day cutting bread and serving soup. Edward Hunter's decision not to bring Alex back into the boardroom was a major reason he was fired. In the second week Alex, was the only member of Logic who did not put himself forward to be project manager, and once again had little presence on the task; the rest of the team declared him the weakest team member on both tasks, with Jim Eastwood going as far as to call him a "spectator". In the boardroom he mounted a vigorous defence, attacking Jim, although Jim countered by stating Alex's contribution had been "nada". Lord Sugar remained unimpressed, and Alex was fired for not showing any leadership potential and for staying in the background rather than stepping up.
In a clip shown on ''You're Fired!'' he was mocked by fellow contestant Glenn Ward who said "Alex? I always forget him." owing to him staying in the background.
== Vincent Disneur == Vincent Disneur was educated at [[St. Anselm's Catholic School]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.courier.co.uk/Apprentice-wind-just-wants-reaction/story-12020808-detail/story.html|title=Apprentice 'wind-up' just wants a reaction 2011|work=Kent and Sussex Courier|date=13 May 2011|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref> a [[voluntary aided school|voluntary aided]] Roman Catholic secondary school in [[Canterbury]] in [[Kent]].
Disneur stepped up to lead the team in the fifth week of the process, but was subsequently fired alongside Ellie Reed in a double firing. While on ''The Apprentice'', Vincent had never been on a winning team.
== Leon Doyle == Leon Doyle is a 26-year-old graduate who was educated at two [[independent school]]s in the town of [[Harrogate]] in [[Yorkshire]], at which he was a day boarder: at [[West End Preparatory School, Harrogate|West End Preparatory School]],<ref name=HarInf>{{cite news|url=http://www.harrogate-news.co.uk/2011/06/23/youre-fired-leon-doyle-interviewed-following-his-exit-from-the-apprentice/|title=You’re fired! - Leon Doyle interviewed following his exit from the Apprentice|work=Harrogate Informer|date=23 June 2011|accessdate=19 November 2014}}</ref> a former boys' preparatory school and [[Ashville College]],<ref name=HarInf/> a co-educational senior school, followed by the [[University of Huddersfield]]. He lived in Leeds and founded the business 'The Master Menu'. He was fired on 22 June (week 8), during a task concerning taking British products into the French Market. He was accused of not contributing enough to the task and using the language barrier as an excuse.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/news/local-west-yorkshire-news/2011/05/06/huddersfield-takeaway-tycoon-leon-doyle-to-star-on-the-apprentice-86081-28643306/ |title=Huddersfield takeaway tycoon Leon Doyle to star on The Apprentice - Huddersfield Examiner |publisher=Examiner.co.uk |date=6 May 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref>
== Jim Eastwood == {{Main|Jim Eastwood}} Jim Eastwood is a 32-year-old Sales & Marketing Manager from [[Northern Ireland]]. He was educated at [[St Mary's Grammar School]], a state grammar school in [[Magherafelt]], and went on to study at the [[University of Ulster]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/entertainment/film-tv/news/ulsterman-aims-to-be-alan-sugars-next-apprentice-28613491.html|title=Ulsterman aims to be Sugar's next Apprentice|work=Belfast Telegraph|author=Sarah Rainey|date=4 May 2011|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref>
Eastwood started work in his father's fish & chip shop chipping potatoes from the age of nine and went on to maintain top sales performances as a Sales and Marketing Manager. Jim, who was "All Ireland cycling champion" as a teenager, champions Richard Branson and describes himself as 'driven, self-motivated, resilient and an eternal optimist.' He said that "I'm not a show pony or a one-trick pony, I'm not a jack-ass or a stubborn mule, and I'm definitely not a wild stallion that needs to be tamed. I am the champion thoroughbred that this process requires."
Eastwood made it to the final, where he proposed an education business called "AMSmart" but was eventually fired. On ''[[The Apprentice: You're Fired!]]'', [[Dara Ó Briain]] nicknamed him "Jedi Jim" because of his uncanny ability to persuade and influence people.
== Melody Hossaini == {{Main|Melody Hossaini}} Melody and her family fled from [[Iran]] when she was a child, and after living for a few years in [[Sweden]], they settled in the UK. Melody started school in the UK at the age of 13, and was educated at [[Great Wyrley High School]],<ref name=E&S>{{cite web|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/news/2011/07/15/business-blossoms-for-apprentice-star-melody-hossaini/|title=Business blossoms for Apprentice star Melody Hossaini|work=Express & Star|date=15 July 2011|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref> a state comprehensive school in the large village of [[Great Wyrley]] in [[South Staffordshire]]. She says that she felt culturally different from the other pupils, some of whom "had not even visited London", while she had lived in several countries. Nevertheless, she performed well in her GCSEs and A-levels before going on to [[Oxford Brookes University]], where she obtained a 2:1 LLB Hons. Law degree. She has lived in four countries and speaks five different languages.<ref name=E&S/>
Melody was the first ever Social Entrepreneur to compete on The Apprentice. Melody is the Founder and CEO of social enterprise, InspirEngage International.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://inspirengage.com/ |title=InspirEngage International | transforming vision into reality |publisher=Inspirengage.com |date= |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> Starting her career aged 13, she now specialises in Skills Training to support individuals into employment and enterprise, through delivery of tailored 'InspirEngage Skills Bootcamps'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.melodyhossaini.com/ |title=Founder & Director, InspirEngage Ltd |publisher=Melody Hossaini |date= |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> She began the series confidently, coming up with the team name 'Venture' and winning as Project Manager on the first week and avoiding the boardroom for a number of tasks. She made it to week ten, before being fired by Lord Sugar 'with regret'.
== Edward Hunter == Edward is a 25-year-old accountant who was trained by one of the United Kingdom's leading accountancy firms. He was the first candidate to be fired in the seventh series of The Apprentice by Lord Sugar.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cityam.com/the-capitalist/harriet-dennys/big-four-hit-back-apprentice-put-down |title=Big Four Hit Back At Apprentice Put-Down | City A.M |publisher=City A.M. |date=13 May 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref>
== Felicity Jackson == Felicity attended [[St Albans High School for Girls]], an [[independent school]] in [[Hertfordshire]], followed by The Court Theatre Training Company. Felicity has set up Casting Days Ltd, and Surviving Actors Ltd - both aimed at actors, and offers different services to help within their career. After three consecutive victories on team Venture, Felicity was moved to Logic to be Project Manager for the Beauty Treatment task; Lord Sugar commented he had not seen much of her up to this point. Unfortunately, Logic's attempt at the task was a total disaster - Felicity later stated on ''You're Fired'' that several mistakes were not even included in the final cut of the episode. Logic were already disadvantaged before they had started selling, as they not only failed to secure the spray-tan system, but more crucially chose a bad location, with the single treatment room being three floors above their selling stall. Felicity then compounded this mistake by over-ordering on products and failing to drive customers upstairs, which was put down to her poor communication with her teammates. Logic thus made a loss of over £200, and Felicity was fired for extreme indecisiveness and poor decision-making. Felicity has since secured a contract with casting website StarNow for her company Casting Days Ltd. She works with casting directors, agents, directors, producers and many more industry professionals, connecting them with StarNow talent. {{citation needed|date=September 2012}}
== Susan Ma == Susan is a 21-year-old Managing Director of Tropic Skin Care Ltd.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tropicskincare.com |title=Welcome to Tropic - Pure Plant Skin Care}}</ref> She was educated at [[Croydon High School]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/susan-ma-from-poverty-in-shanghai-to-lord-sugars-boardroom-6425641.html|title=Susan Ma: from poverty in Shanghai to Lord Sugar's boardroom|work=[[London Evening Standard]]|author=Joshi Herrmann|date=25 July 2011|accessdate=19 November 2014}}</ref> an [[independent school]] for girls in [[Croydon]] in South London, and graduated in 2010 from [[University College London]] with a 2:1 in Philosophy and Economics. She was described by [[Nick Hewer]] as "a little force to be reckoned with"...  At the beginning of the process, Susan had difficulty making herself heard, but in Week 3 led Venture to a narrow victory on the Discount Buying task - although her team only got small discounts, they managed to locate 9 of the 10 items, in contrast to Logic's 6. Her performance in week 4 on the Beauty Treatments task was less impressive - as the industry expert in cosmetics, she advised Zoe Beresford on key decisions at the start of the task, but was blamed for a massive overspend on products that left the team with a small profit. While Lord Sugar criticised this mistake, Susan was visibly angered by Zoe's attitude, particularly during the task when Zoe confronted her about the excess stock, which Susan saw as an attempt to make her a scapegoat. Tensions rose again in week 6 on the Rubbish task, as Zoe dismissed Susan's suggestion to secure clients set up by Lord Sugar for waste disposal by paying a small fee for valuable scrap, and insisted on charging for the team's services. Susan was vindicated when both clients opted for the deals offered by Logic, and Venture lost the task as a result. Zoe brought Susan into the boardroom for being a weak contributor and an annoying presence, but Susan acquitted herself well, and although she interrupted Lord Sugar's deliberations, she escaped with only a warning.
Susan was brought into the boardroom again the following week, this time by Jim Eastwood after the magazine task, and was branded the "mouse" of team Venture due to her consistent failure to make herself heard. She responded with an impassioned defence, and survived while Glenn Ward was fired. In week 8, she took on the role of project manager again to sell English products in Paris, and despite some rather bizarre questions about the French, made good choices with her products, while Helen Milligan secured a huge order from a major retailer, achieving the largest Apprentice victory in terms of cash margin at the time.
In the final, Susan offered up the best overall business plan of the four finalists, but was let down by her boasts about how much money could be generated in the first few years. Deciding that Susan needed more experience in the world of business, Lord Sugar fired her, along with fellow contestants Helen Milligan and Jim Eastwood, as inventor Tom Pellereau went on to win the series.{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} In ''You're Hired!'', Lord Sugar said that he had always wished to be associated with skin care business, and that with Tom's nail filer on board, he would keep in touch with Susan to assemble a team.
== Helen Milligan == Helen was born in Stockport, Greater Manchester in October 1980.<ref>[http://helenmilligan.co.uk/about-me.aspx About Me] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128082202/http://www.helenmilligan.co.uk/about-me.aspx# |date=28 January 2013 }} from [http://helenmilligan.co.uk/ Helen Milligan homepage] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128080718/http://www.helenmilligan.co.uk/# |date=28 January 2013 }}</ref> Following a degree from [[De Montfort University]] in Law (2:1), Helen worked as a Business Development Support Manager at BB's Coffee and Muffins. Most recently she has acted as an executive assistant to the CEO following a spell as a regional manager for Gregg's in the Midlands.<ref name="investoo.co.uk">{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.investoo.co.uk/revealed-the-real-jobs-of-the-apprentice-stars/ |title=Revealed! The real jobs of The Apprentice stars |work=Investoo.co.uk |date=6 June 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121229113422/http://www.investoo.co.uk/revealed-the-real-jobs-of-the-apprentice-stars/ |archivedate=29 December 2012 |df= }}</ref> Helen holds the record for the highest number of successive ''Apprentice'' wins; she was on the winning team for the first nine tasks before losing in Week 10. Previously, the record was held by James Max and Tre Azam, who won six consecutive tasks in Series 1 and 3 respectively. She also holds the record for the best performance in the series (10-1 win/lose ratio) and holds the joint record for success a project manager 3-0, with series five winner Yasmina Siadatan. In addition, she made the most money during the programme than anyone else, breaking the record for the most money ever won on a task in Week 8, and then breaking her own record again in Week 9. She was the Runner-Up of series 7 of the show. She has now been promoted by Greggs to Head Of Retail in the South East.
== Tom Pellereau == Tom was educated at [[Twyford School]], a co-educational [[independent school]] in the village of Twyford in [[Hampshire]], before moving to [[St Edward's School, Oxford]] aged 13. He achieved a 1st class degree as well as a masters in Mechanical Engineering and Innovation from the [[University of Bath]]. His ambition has always been to be an inventor and this is reflected by his continued approach to product development. Some of his inventions to date have included: the Stylfile (a curved nail file), an Ethical Goods brand that connects brands with relevant charities, Mode Diagnostics (bowel cancer screening tool), Babisil (first collapsible silicon baby bottle) and the Amadeus acoustic screen for musicians.
Tom remained on team Logic for the entire series, and thus gained a win:loss ratio of 3:8, the worst of any UK Apprentice winner. In the first 5 weeks, where he lost every task, he gained a reputation for being a "hindsight man" and alongside fellow contestant [[Jim Eastwood]], his strategy of getting out of the last three for the first five weeks during Logic's losing streak was discussed on the spin-off special ''How to Get Hired''; there were several occasions where he identified key flaws in the team strategy, but lacked the force of character to persuade his fellow candidates to change course. A notable example was in the advertising task, when Tom unsuccessfully attempted to persuade Vincent Disneur and Jim Eastwood that their branding choice would make the product unsellable; Vincent was subsequently fired, while Jim had a narrow escape. Tom was later elected as Project Manager to sell in France, and although his instincts about the products were correct, he was persuaded otherwise by Melody Hossaini, and Logic suffered a catastrophic loss. Tom only avoided firing because Leon Doyle had even less presence in the team than he did. He then had another close call in Week 9, where his biscuit design was universally panned and earned no orders whatsoever. However, his third boardroom appearance happened more by default; Tom was responsible for half of Logic's revenue, while Melody and Helen Milligan had pursued a totally unsustainable strategy that saw them lose despite Venture earning a considerable fine.
In the final of the series, Tom came under fire for his poorly written up business plan for office equipment for back problems, but was praised for his creativity and business experience. He was subsequently declared the winner of The Apprentice from series seven.<ref name="investoo.co.uk"/> Although Tom won the series, Sugar rejected the initial business plan and instead encouraged him to expand the Stylfile into a range of grooming products.
== Ellie Reed == Born in Bradford, Yorks, Ellie is the co-founder and managing director of [[Shipley, West Yorkshire|Shipley]]-based recruitment firm A&E Construction.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.constructionenquirer.com/2011/05/04/recruitment-boss-battles-to-be-lord-sugars-apprentice/ |title=Recruitment boss battles to be Lord Sugar's apprentice |work=Construction Enquirer |date=4 May 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> She graduated from [[Sheffield Hallam University]] in 1999 with a degree in psychology.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.linkedin.com/pub/ellie-reed/14/278/4a6 |title=Ellie Reed |publisher=LinkedIn |date= |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> She is a keen golfer and is a dog-owner. Ellie was fired on the fifth episode of the show, in a double-firing with Vincent. A survivor of [[cervical cancer]], Ellie campaigns for women to undergo regular [[smear test]]s<ref>{{cite web |last=Clayton |first=Emma |title=Bradford entrepreneur who runs Shipley firm A&E Construction Recruitment and A&E Facilities 'fired' |url=http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/local/localbrad/9060468.Lord_Sugar_tells_Apprentice_hopeful_Ellie_Reed___You_re_fired__/ |newspaper=[[Telegraph & Argus]] |location=Bradford |date=2 June 2011 |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref> and has established her own consultancy firm to encourage young people into business careers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elliereed.co.uk/about.html |title=About Ellie |publisher=Ellie Reed Consultancy Ltd |date= |accessdate=2013-08-11}}</ref>
== Natasha Scribbins ==
Natasha Scribbins was educated at The Richard Huish in Taunton Somerset, before completing her degree at Bournemouth University in the UK. Natasha has a strong career in the recruitment and staffing industry having worked for global organisations such as Hays and Randstad. Natasha specializes in Oil, Gas and Chemical markets and lives and works in the major oil and gas hub, Houston, Texas, USA. She was fired in week 11 of the series, after winning two tasks as Project Manager.<ref name=BE>{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Davey |url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/news/9143199.Former_Bournemouth_student_Natasha_bids_farewell_to_The_Apprentice/ |title=Former Bournemouth student Natasha bids farewell to The Apprentice |newspaper=[[Bournemouth Daily Echo]] |date=16 July 2011 |accessdate=11 August 2013}}</ref>
<ref name="BE"/>
== Glenn Ward == Senior Design Engineer Glenn, from Hertfordshire, is a keen amateur footballer who cites Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg as his inspiration. He was fired in Week 7, when his 'Hip Replacement' magazine met with heavy criticism.
== Gavin Winstanley == Gavin was fired on the third episode of the show. He originates from Liverpool, and runs his own opticians.
